Kirsten Gillibrand said Friday that she will sit on the Republican side of the House floor next to Barack Obama John Thune , R-S.D. This is just a symbol, but it sends an important message that although we may disagree on various issues, we all stand ready to work together and do what we believe is right for the country, Kirsten Gillibrand said in a statement.
